subject: linear_algebra
title: QR Decomposition
contentHtml:
The QR decomposition is a fundamental concept in linear algebra that has numerous applications in machine learning and artificial intelligence.

Given a matrix A, the QR decomposition expresses A as the product of an orthogonal matrix Q and an upper triangular matrix R:

\(\mathbf{A} = \mathbf{QR}\)

This decomposition is particularly useful when working with matrices that have orthonormal columns, such as those arising from principal component analysis (PCA).

",
name: QR Decomposition" },
problemHtml: Suppose we have a matrix A that represents the coefficients of a linear regression model. We want to decompose A into its orthogonal and upper triangular components using QR decomposition.
explanation: The R matrix is upper triangular and contains the coefficients of the linear regression model." } ],
finalAnswer: The QR decomposition of A is Q and R" },
intuition: QR decomposition provides a way to factorize a matrix into its orthogonal and upper triangular components, which can be useful in various machine learning and artificial intelligence applications.
